Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Avicenna.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my children, as you have completed this book, the last of medical science, through the fulfillment of its purpose it has come to an end, and due to its expositions, explanations, and declarations, I believe you now possess great knowledge from this treatise, which is a part of the most important operation, namely surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery, considered the most important operation in our region and time, has been largely forgotten due to the lack of knowledge about it, and the study of it has ceased; its principles are closed, its force weakened, and its art neglected, as is evident from the few descriptions found in the books of the Ancients.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it has seemed to me that I should revive the order of this treatise according to the second way of exposition, declaration, and abbreviation; so that the forms of cautery tools and other surgical instruments may be added for clarification, and preparation, which is necessary for its execution.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause why our skillful doctor lacks mastery in this our time is that the art of medicine is lengthy, and he does not have sufficient training in the science of anatomy which reveals how the joints work within each member and their forms; and the connection and separation of them; and knowledge of bones, nerves, and tendons, and the number of these, and their extraction; and also of pulsating veins and static ones, and the places from which they emanate.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason Hippocrates says that the name is worthy, yet in practice it is small, especially in the art of healing.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already spoken of this in the introduction to this book; for those who are ignorant of what we have said about anatomy, it is not surprising that they fall into errors from which men can die, as you have seen many such people, some formed in this science and others having gained knowledge of it through experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	You see a foolish doctor who has cut open a pus-filled abscess in the breast of a woman, and he has cut some arteries in her breast so that much blood flows out until the woman dies from it.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And you see another doctor who attempts to remove a stone from a man who had passed it, and the stone is large, and he comes to him and extracts that stone with a part of his bladder, so that man dies on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already called for help to remove it, and you see that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, he knows that he will die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And you see another doctor who is paid handsomely by a duke of our land to perform surgery, and he takes a black cat that was badly broken; due to his ignorance, the doctor extracts the fracture over the wound, with pincers and forceps, but does not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then dislodge it according to their wishes, and apply rest, and elevate for some days, and order that the bandage be removed; and thus also for the foot, if it has healed, so that the matter does not recur and cause harm.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And they have often called upon him, and prepared to loosen the bandage, and as a result, there is peace and thus an end to their pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if the corruption is already confirmed in the member, then it cannot be restrained, and the corruption does not cease to spread throughout the member until the danger of the illness increases.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I have seen another doctor who perforates a cancerous fistula, and it becomes an ulcer that takes several days to heal, until the malignancy of the disease increases under his care.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which causes the pain to be purely from melancholic humor, and it does not cover that it will harm them completely, but rather that it should be in the member where they suffer most.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation be divided into two parts: one is in an operation associated with health, and the other is in a work which is perilous to the greatest dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already encountered this throughout all parts of this book where operations are discussed that contain error and fear; for it is necessary for you to keep this and reject that, so that people do not take the wrong path and speak against you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	So take up your tools with diligence and the protection of God, and your patients as an ease and a stability.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best means by the grace of God to achieve salvation and glorious success, leave behind terrible illnesses with difficult healing, and set aside your fears so that your faith and your name are not abandoned: for more remains to your glory, both now in this world and forever after in your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	He already dissected in some of his own members:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not cure bad ailments improperly, lest bad doctors become renowned.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first, from the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered deals with the feet, in the forms of instruments and the craftsmanship of cauterization tools, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	Division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter discusses incision and perforation, and the use of cupping glasses, poultices, and extracts from arrows and similar objects, all chapters and ordered according to the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of twists and similar conditions; a well-ordered chapter on internal foot issues and the shapes of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cautery with fire and sharp medicine, and the recollection of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	At that point begins the treatment of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Understand what I have said about the quality of the materials for that cautery and the documents related to it, and in what circumstances cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, it is said that the discourse on the quality of cautery materials and the documents related to them is long, prolix, and subtle in its knowledge, and secrets are hidden within it; and much has been written about it by scholars, but there are disagreements among them, so I will content myself with a brief discussion of their points.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that cautery will relieve every condition universally, whether it be of material or its matter, except for two conditions, which are conditions that have their own matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the condition that is dry and hard, the matter is out of balance; some say that cautery is beneficial for such cases, while others say the contrary, claiming that cautery is not appropriate for ailments caused by dryness and hardness, as the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it would be counterproductive to treat a condition that is dry and hard with heat and dryness.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the contrary claim that cautery is beneficial for all dry and hard conditions seen in the bodies of men, because when you compare the body of man and its humidity to the condition of fire, you find the body of man to be rough.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And he says through the discourse of those who claim this, that he has already experimented with it several times to discover.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not advisable to attempt this without proper training and knowledge, as one who has already been initiated and practiced in the art of cautery on various parts of the body, knows well the diversity of human anatomy, the disposition of ailments within their members, the causes of these, and the circumstances surrounding them, and the passage of time regarding these.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other complex cases, there is no need to fear, especially in gouty and humid ailments, for all doctors are in agreement about these, and they do not disagree on the treatment with cautery in these cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and the goodness of it, lies in cautery as a medicinal remedy, for fire is simple; its action affects only the member being cauterized, without causing pain to other members nearby, except perhaps with a slight sensation.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of the medicinal fire reaches those members from which it draws its strength, and it strongly affects a member suffering from a difficult-to-heal ailment, aiding its recovery.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Kindle the fire, due to its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, for it does nothing but superfluous things. It has long been known to us from experience and from the longevity of studying the art regarding the truth of causes; and therefore you are excused from the length of speech. If it were not that it is read at my own leisure in this brief moment, I would secretly keep the fire from you, as well as the quality of the operation in the body and its expulsion by which you expel illnesses, demonstrated through philosophical discourse, which would be sharpened in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know this, my children, that the timing of when to perform cautery and place pads is best during springtime.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cauterization is convenient at all times, so that the damage caused by time's accident is overshadowed by the healing of what is thrown off by cautery, especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary aches, severe and acute, which do not suffer from delay, since it is feared of those who come with evil, that it is better to inflict minimal damage entering at the right time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus, do not sit on your feet, my sons, for it is only the common people and foolish doctors who value such things; for that illness which is healed by cautery does not always return, but leaves its consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they believe, for cautery is merely a place of medicine that alters the composition and dries up the humors which are the cause of the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet, one may use cautery superfluously over medicine because of the desire for its validity and virtue in operation and the greatness of their lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that their illness may return at some time in the future, depending on the composition of the illness and the location of their affliction, and the strength of it, and what is prepared within them from the addition of excesses and humors, and what has come to them through their food and similar causes; but the illness in which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a few excesses and humors, just as dental cautery for pain and similar conditions, so it may be that that pain does not return, but this is done in small doses.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is often said in popular speech that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is true speech, not to those who understand it, for they believe that it is not a cure that profit through medicine or any other cause near cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is to the contrary; and I understand that saying a cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when one administers methods of healing in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not take effect, and then at the end of the cause, one applies a cautery and profits from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here it follows that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding of the vulgar and too many lay physicians.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that a gold cautery is better than an iron cautery, and they did not say this but for the equality of the gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cautery does not cause pain, which is not entirely true, for you have already seen and experienced that it only causes pain in some bodies; cautery with fire from gold is good and better than what they said; nevertheless, when you make a cautery with fire, be careful, because gold melts according to the quantity you want, due to the intensity of the heat, and if you place it over the fire, some sheets may fall into the fire so that the artisan suffers from occupation.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, cautery with iron requires that we hold it lightly and precisely to ensure the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And you have already organized this chapter on cautery according to other chapters, and you have ordered those from the beginning related to the feet, so that now I am asking him what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	About cautery for head pain caused by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers dryness and coldness upon the affected part, which is the primary cause of sudden and numerous rheumatic fluxes, called chills, from the head to the extremities of the arms and legs, as well as many sleep-related issues, toothache and throat pain, and generally any illness that arises from cold, also causing paralysis, stiffness, and apoplexy, and similar conditions in those maladies.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method for this cautery is as follows: first, command the evacuation of the illness using laxative medicines, three or four nights in a row, according to the nature of the illness, the patient's age, and their usual condition.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command them to shave their head, and make a cut between their thighs on a clean bench, and place their hands on the afflicted foot.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place your palm's pressure on the bridge of their nose between their eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the said condition of the middle part is overcome, mark that place with a try, and then apply the olive-shaped cautery whose form is this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that over the healthy area marked with a try, descending in such a way that the patient's hand is gradually constrained, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then gently lift your hand and inspect the area, and if you see that any bone is exposed, as well as any amount of gum or stone (calculus), lift your hand, and if not, return your hand to that instrument, or another one from it, while keeping it cold until you are able to see the bone.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt, dissolve it over the area, and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your hand over the area soaked in border and leave it on the inside until the wall of fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the treatment to the area with the four-part remedy until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it is said that when the Roman plague opens up, the better the brace, as it is more beneficial and restorative.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they say that some of them cauterize the cord within the bone and hold the cautery until some part of the bone's specific nature is hardened.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then they remove what is adjusted to the bone, and then it is cleaned.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they say others that with the cautery to reach the deepest, it strengthens the bone from within, so that the bone does not break, and this is the form of creating small incisions:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that from that place, vapours from the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound remains open for a long time, it should be treated until it heals and hardens.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not recommend these two types of cautery to everyone, but only to certain individuals out of fear; and in those cases, when it is necessary for healing, it is best done as soon as possible, as we have seen with the other members, especially when the head of the malady is of a feverish nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The specific type of cautery, when applied correctly, is the safest and best method for healing; and from that practice and with that work comes health.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	On the head cautery.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and prolonged pain occurs in the entire head, and this persists for an extended period of time, and various remedies such as herbs, combs, caps, plasters, guazes, caldrons, goats, sheep, and similar treatments are used, especially if a cautery has already been performed that does not address the root cause of the malady, then one must consider whether the nature of the head ailment is robust; if there is no significant or severe pain, then another cautery should be applied.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area on the side of the head where the hairline is parted using an internal cautery.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the hairline and expose the bone as much as we have found, and cauterize that area with a cautery at the rear part of the head in the place called "vas" - it is the location where the wind is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And apply your hand to it, do not expose the bone, for the illness finds great pain through this, different from the pain of all other cauterizations on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you should perform this cauterization in its proper place, because you know that the cauterization which treats the horns of the head and the occiput is a more subtle cauterization than the one performed on the middle part of the head; and this is its form.
Capitol ters.	Capitol terms. (Note: This appears to be a heading or a title, not a sentence to translate.)
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the treatment of old migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a severe pain arises at the base of the head or a burning pain extends to the ear, it is treated with medicines that cleanse the head, and other cures, as I have mentioned regarding the deviances of illnesses; and if these do not prove effective, cauterization on it is performed in two ways: either with acute medicinal fire, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May there be cauteries or burning medicines, you should take a hot cloth, cut it open, and extract the extreme ends of it from both heads.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then you should incise the painful area on the temple with a lance, carefully so as not to cause further harm, until the pain is alleviated.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then you should stretch it strongly after the swelling has subsided, and leave it for three hours; and afterward, extract the foreign body, and apply a poultice for two or three days, and keep the affected area submerged in cold water until the pain ceases.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then you should apply a cure made from a potion, as long as it heals.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, perform these using some of the burning medicines that I have written about in the two treatises on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Apply the cautery according to this manner: take a hot iron whose shape is as follows:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called a claw clamp because its head has the shape of a claw with some curvature, and in the middle part there is a small eminence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then apply pressure over the painful area, hold your hand—to prevent the skin from being burned—and slowly turn the iron at a controlled speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of blood stuck due to the specific condition of the vein is such that it equals or exceeds the capacity of the vein, raise your hand so that the artery below is not affected, preventing any flow of pus.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak it in salt water and place it over the area for three days; also apply a lot of heat, and take care to use ointment until it heals.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, burn the end of the knife with a cautery, and be careful not to make an incision into the artery in this fresh wound especially.
Capitol quart.	Capital quarter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of old wounds.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When treating an old wound as we have discussed in the previous treatment and the divisions of illnesses, and if the treatment does not improve or worsens due to the illness that does not allow access to what we have said about the initial cauterization with medicine or fire, then you must ignite the cuticular cautery until it is whitened, indicating over the area of pain along the length of which is the most intense, or where; and rest your hand for a moment and press deeply as you make an incision into the arteria.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful about the continuation of the jaw, which is damaged and affects chewing, that the fracture is not healed and the nerves which are affected by it, and that a spasm does not occur.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it concerns the care and caution regarding the flow of blood from an artery that is severed, as in the case of its abrupt separation, there is fear, especially for those who do not understand what they are doing and lack study and patience; and thus, surgery on them should be delayed.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you should return to the recollection of the regulation of the flow of blood from an artery according to its nature in its proper place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you find that this illness does not respond to the cautery and see that the patient's condition is tolerable, perform the cautery in the middle part of the head as we have mentioned, and treat the wound until it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, apply the cautery as we have said in the chapter on the tightness of archery with a cautery that has two blades; this is the better and more effective cauterization.
Capitol .v.	**Chapter: On the Treatment of Joint Pain (Gout)**
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the treatment of earache.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear caused by cold and it is treated with purgative remedies and other cures as mentioned in the previous section, and if the pain persists, apply heat with a cautery, which is known as a 'point', and this is its form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then apply the point close to the heat source, and turn it around the entire ear or in any direction if the pain is in any part of it.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Keep the heat application on the ear gradually, until the area is healed and free from pain.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the heat application with these points is done on the entire ear, and some are left, then treat the areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	**Capital VI.**
De cauterizacio de turtura.	**On the cauterization of tortuous (varicose) veins.**
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The tortuous veins that are cured and treated by cauterization are nothing but the species that arise from phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Cauterization should be avoided for this species that is meant to dry up or spasm the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that species of tortuous vein with squeezing and purging, but do not confirm your treatment, then know that you cauterize the illness in three places: first, you cut the ear's edge, second, you make a small incision near their temple, and third, you target the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery to the opposite side of the diseased part, for relaxation is only found in the part that appears sound.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is that you cauterize with a hot iron on the right side of the ear's lobe, slightly above the ear canal, and on the temple, whose length corresponds to the length of the finger, and place your hand over it until the quantity of the substance of the cord is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is specifically from a cutting tool, the shape of which is placed face-up.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it may be even more subtle, as you can see with your eyes, and take care to avoid excessive roughness on it.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of the area that is exposed during the procedure until it heals.
Capitol .vii.	Capital VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and treatment with what we have said does not help and the patient has no fever, then cauterize as follows: first on all corners of their head; second, at the middle point of the head, as we have said; and third, on the joint (or 'coguot').
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cautery is done according to what has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and it is more delayed; and then it is carefully treated with what you have processed.
Capitol .viii.	Capital VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the cauterization of an oblivion made by inflammation.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	You should give the patient herbs and small pills at the beginning, which the servants will prepare and administer.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then thoroughly wash the patient's head, and place on their wound the plaster described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And repeat this several times, for that is the manner of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do it according to the order of those methods I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And thus, if it is for the good of the patient, do so; otherwise, make three cauterizations to them on the back part of their head, descending from the higher part of the head towards the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And between each cautery, he should pay attention to the thickness of the skin, and then take care to apply the cautery correctly.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If the patient endures the pain, and the disease is in the middle part of the body, then make the cautery on the middle part; but if greater suffering occurs, cauterize it over both humps.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Take care of that which is healed; and make the cautery olive-shaped according to the form given above.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of parasites and the softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col. E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma. Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the treatment of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic should not be cauterized, but rather the type of epilepsy caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so it is important to cleanse the brain of the patient at the beginning, applying heat and other cures as we have discussed in the previous division when the illness is severe and tolerant of medicinal treatment.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate medications, then administer liquids and easy-to-digest foods for several days, to the benefit of their diet.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the head of the patient, and apply a cautery to that area with a cautery in the middle part of the head according to the previous manner, and apply another cautery at the back of their head, and over any corners of the head that have been cauterized.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then apply cauteries as mentioned above, with a view to having a paralytic and relaxing effect on the body over the cervical and dorsal spines.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And apply the olive cautery as mentioned above.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	If the patient is a child, then apply subtle cauteries according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter .XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi. E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio. And do this to the patient every day for a week, or follow another regimen of his good food until he is cured; or if you prefer, cauterize those making small dots according to what is most appropriate for him, but always hold your hand over it in an orderly manner: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then apply that warm compress on the edges or in the colors of sheep's wool.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the draining of water from the swelling.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz. Then command the patient to scrape their head, and cauterize the affected area with a hot iron at the middle of the head; and cauterize with two irons over two temples if it is the onset of water in two swellings, or on one side if it is the onset of water in one swelling.

E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flows when cauterizing; and if you see blood flow from it, stop any further treatment, which is within your power.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And seek knowledge that is extracted from arteries, and amputation of those, and cauterization to prevent blood flows.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	Sometimes, the neck is cauterized between two bones using two cauterizing tools.
Capitol .xiii.	**Chapter XIII**
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	**On the cauterization of old tears.**
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the eyes are chronic and through veins and arteries in the manifest location of the head outside, and it is verified that this causes superflux of weak muscles, cauterize that with a pointed cautery as we have described in the chapter on starting hot water in the eyes, cauterize in the middle location of the head, and two cauterizations below the temples, and two cauterizations below the bones of the neck.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is additional indigestion, cauterize that across the entire surface of the eye's coat on the extremity of the upper eyelid with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of nasal discharge.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When treating the condition we described in the previous section and if your treatment does not benefit the patient, prepare and make them drink a mixture of herbs for three nights; then shave their head and cauterize with a middle-sized cautery or an olive-sized cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then apply a cautery to that, using two cauteries on each of the eyelids, leaving the hairs intact.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And the shape of the cautery claw is as follows.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of the cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or moisture, apply a cautery to that eyelid with this lunar cautery; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, apply a cautery to both eyelids with a small cautery across the entire area, and they should be elongated from the temporals.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the quantity of the swelling.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with the cautery, but according to how much the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	**Chapter XVI.**
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Regarding the cautery of the eyelid, when the hairs turn inside out and place the cautery on the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eyelid are turned inside out and placed on the eye, cauterization is done in two manners: either by making a cut or by using a medicated burning cautery.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If the cautery is with fire, command the patient to open their eyes wide, so that the hairs are pulled out along with those that remain, as long and thick as possible; and if you have to put them back, tighten the eyes with a bandage so that the hairs do not grow again.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore when they are born and equally engorged, you shall place the patient's head in a low position, then gently press over the eyelid of their eye, signaling according to the shape of a dead leaf, and this is the beginning of the signal near the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then apply a cold compress or a thick paste of owl's egg or bird droppings to the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then ignite the cautery whose shape is as follows.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize according to the shape that is indicated, gradually, in multiple attempts, until the surface of the wound is completely sealed, just as it is with myrtle leaves, appearing properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of healing of the eye work is that you see the eyelid of the eye contracted and the hairs raised above the point of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so raise your hand and place it there for three days, and then apply a bandage to the affected area until the swelling subsides.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that ointment until it heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If it returns through the skin for any reason and the eyelid becomes soft, then do the cautery again on that entire area just as you did originally.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the hairs are on the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural position and healed, so that the hairs do not reappear.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with medicinal fire is what you order for the patient to remove the hairs until they are prolonged and healed, and then make a bandage in the shape of a myrtle leaf from cloth.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take some known soap and a live cause, or whatever it is, and mix those good causes together, making a feast of it so that it is not chilled; and spread this from it on the paper which is made thus in the form of a myrtle leaf, and place it over one or both wounds; and leave the fragrant edge wrapped in white honey, and the patient's head in the tiara.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And now let me tell you about the medicine, and apply it gently, not forcing it, so that the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for the bite is like fire within them.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so as you continue with this that the disease bites, then cease the medicine and apply it again to the right place; thus, when the biting stops, remove the medicine and wash the wound with water; and consider whether the eyelid is lifted as it should be washed daily with either fire or an incision, for that is good. And if it does not return to the application of the medicine to the place where the medicine was not absorbed and does not disfigure your work, but rather tightens the wound.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then apply pressure to the area until the pain of the adhesion is eradicated, and take care of it with a definitive ointment or another until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to perform your operation with careful vigilance so that no part of the medicine falls out, and if the eyelid after a few days becomes softened due to any cause from the hairs in the socket, then repeat your medicine on that area which has become softened from the eyelid, and precisely as you did at the beginning, and envelop it until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method of extracting the myrtle.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the eyes of men differ in size and smallness, and therefore your compression should be made accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of correction should not be hidden from him who is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter .xvii.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula in the lacrimal duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When treating a fistula using the method described in the previous sections and your treatment does not yield results, you should proceed as follows: have the patient lie down with their head raised on pillows, and hold their head steady with one hand between their thighs in such a way that it is neither moved nor agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then apply some hot compress or a paste of egg whites and poultry feathers to the eye of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And make the cautery as follows:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be convex, shaped like a cane or a feather pen, from one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you look, they penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to get out this way, do so with caution.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, he who is calm is better suited to the surgical work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And press the fistula if it is open, and try to clean and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place on it a cautery that has been well-ignited, and with your hand, slightly deviate the cautery from the nose's opening, so that your hand or the patient's pain is not aggravated, and afterward, apply the cautery to the grays of the nose and burn it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if, at the beginning of applying the cautery, it enters into the bone, that is good; otherwise, repeat the cautery once or twice, as necessary; leave it in place for three days, and then apply pressure to that area with a border, and surround it with a drying agent until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If after passing ten days it is not healed, then apply a sharp, corrosive medicine to it until the bone is exposed and it heals as it should in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way to make a fistula cautery that some masters have said: enter the place of the fistula and close it, then apply pressure on the smooth crack from which it is formed; and pour into that as much molten lead as necessary; with your hand held in good retention, do not let the patient's condition worsen so that the melted lead does not reach the wound; and cover where you are applying pressure over the wound with a cloth dipped in oil or water, so that the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it miraculously.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cautery and treatment, it is good; otherwise, it will be necessary to administer a drain from the nose and reduce the fistula to the body of the nose as it will come in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On cauterization of the fistula.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Various accidents cause fissures in the lips, especially in children's lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those fissures as we have said in the previous sections and do not benefit from your treatment, then use a hot iron in the shape of a knife as follows:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And the depth of the wound should be according to the thickness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Place your hand carefully over those fissures so that the cautery reaches the depth of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of that wet compress until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When, during the extraction of the uvula or the palate or the roots of the teeth, bleeding occurs and it is then clamped and becomes old and a fistula forms and you treat it but do not allow healing, then ignite a cautery according to the amount received in the fistula, and insert that fire into the opening of the fistula, and with your hand bring the burning flame to its depth, doing this once or twice; and take care of that compress as we have said about treatment until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And thus if the wound is clean and healed, it is good; but if not, it will be necessary to expose the location and remove the corrupt bone as will be discussed in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	**Capitol XX:**
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the treatment of teeth and the softening of arteries.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the arteries are softened by moisture and the teeth are loosened, and these conditions are treated with medicines rather than surgery, then place the patient's head in a low position, and shape the cautery so that it can be inserted between the tooth and the gum, applying the hot cautery quickly so that the patient feels only a slight pain from the heat of the fire, aiming for the root of the tooth to be freed.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand, and repeat the application of the cautery several times as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and do this for an hour, after which they should spit it out, because the loosened tooth will be securely held in place, the gums softened will tighten, and the moisture corrupted will be dried.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the treatment of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to cold, or there is swelling or pus, and the treatment with medicine does not help, then cautery should be performed in two ways: either with a cow's gut cautery or with a fire cautery.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with cow's gut involves taking a piece of cow's gut and slicing it open lengthwise, then wrapping it around the base of the tooth, heating it over fire, and applying it to the painful tooth while keeping it warm until it is numbed by cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the heat from the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see, dip a cloth or cloth in the wound of your side, place it over the painful tooth, and place the ignited iron on it until the iron reaches the depth of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the use of fire for cauterization is to address the wound of a tooth or iron, and it should be performed gently in the heart of the wound without the heat reaching the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then shape the cautery as required, place it over the tooth and rest your hand on it until the cautery cools; do this several times as the pain may return either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that the patient opens their mouth wide with the aid of this cautery, holding it for an hour and then spitting it out; this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And apply the cautery as you have seen it necessary to do.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the catheter:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On cauterization of hernias.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are caused by a mixture of fluid and humors that are resistant to treatment by medicines, and you wish to reduce them slightly, apply the cautery along the shape of which this follows, having two sharp ends so that smoke comes from the cautery on one side, and you apply the glowing end over the affected area once, or as often as necessary, until it reaches the center of the hernia.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. Capitol .xxiii.	**Chapter XXIII**
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of ulcers and the constriction of veins.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut. Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On cauterization of the titillium, which is the head of the assistant.

De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On cauterization of the liver.
