When liver pain is caused by friction and moisture, which prevents conception, corrupts the menstruation, delays their flow, and causes severe pain during their discharge, then know that this location must be cauterized with three cauteries in a circle around the navel, as we have said regarding the bladder; or two cauteries at a lower point on the back, and drive them in firmly.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter .XL.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On cauterization of the dislocated ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist mucus infiltrates the joint of the ankle, causing it to dislocate, a sign of this is that one part appears longer than the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of the dislocation is compressed in him quickly.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then you should cauterize the patient over the dislocated ankle with a circular cautery, since you have already tried to straighten the joint by pulling on its circuit, and thus the dislocation falls back into place in the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the cautery mentioned above has the same form in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not available to you, then cauterize it with three large olive cauteries.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And make the cautery according to the amount of inflammation in all the vein; and be careful with that which is healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter .xli. (Forty-first Chapter)
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain appears in the region of the ankle, caused by cold, moisture, and inflammation, the condition is treated with the methods we have mentioned and should not be overlooked; furthermore, you must remove the affected part from thick humors using putrid pills or artificial ones similar to them, and then cauterize it.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the manner of the cautery on that part follows two ways: either with cauterizing medicines that burn, or with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	According to two scientific methods, one of which is to cauterize that over the opening of the anus with three triangular cauterizes in this manner; and do so with good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the spaces between each cauterize should be according to the thickness of the said part, and if the cauterizes are olive-sized or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Sometimes, four cauterizes may be placed on the middle part of the anus for better effect.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, cauterize the circle that follows the shape in the cauterization of the hernia of the anus, which should be a complete circle and burn away all the openings of the intestines.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the method of cauterization in cases where pain is attached to the anus and not spread throughout the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	If it is stretched within the thigh, then cauterize that with two cauteries over the thigh at the place where you direct the pain; and apply a cautery to the shin for four days on the outer side.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is cutaneous, then the depth of the cautery should be according to the intensity of the pain.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the pain spreads to the place near the feet, then cauterize that area with a cautery at three points or four or more, as needed.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient feels pain when moving the thigh, then cauterize that area with a cutaneous cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And be careful in all cauterization so that you do not injure nerves or cause great pain, and that by doing so to the patient, you do them no further harm or restrict their movement.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And you have already seen one of those which will be cauterized on the shin and finished in the cauterization process, and a heated bed with an inflated pillow until the swelling reaches the foot, and the fire pierced and corrupted the entire foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then I apply a strong acid solution of the abdomen, and this brings about death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts, simultaneously cauterize each according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise ones say about the cauterization of water cauteries, of which this is the manner: make it resemble a circle of iron whose circumference is the width of a palm; and its orifice should be according to the thickness of a date palm bone or almost a little more.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And within that circle, another one is drawn, which is one-third of the original; and the space between them should be the length of a night's rest; and these circles are divided into two parts; and the length of those sides should be a night or two nights, and this is the form of it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Soon as it is heated over a fire until it glows and sparks, then place it gently on the wound, the patient lying on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And so, it is cauterized with three round cautery burns at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then apply this for three days; cover the wound with a poultice and leave it open for several days; and take care to keep the area clean until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Albucasis says: O, sons, we have seldom used this kind of cautery because of the fear surrounding it, and because few have found those that guard over it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	One should apply the best cautery to those who suffer from it, and find out the place of their pain.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	Perhaps the text is describing a medical procedure for treating a hernia:
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space between certain parts of the body is such that it corresponds to the thickness of the mentioned part; they should be placed under and over it, and they should hold themselves together in this way:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	Then place your hand over the part where the patient feels pain in their side, and take some cold water, pour it between two circles, and its quality should be small fire bit by bit, and hold it for an hour, and let the patient endure the bite and adhesion - because that burning bite is like fire - until the bite ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	Then raise your hand with the instrument and dry the cold water from all the water with warm water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	Then apply this for three days and place your hand on that border until the blackness of the adhesion disappears, and leave it for some more days, and it will heal; this is better in youth.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the proper treatment until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	If the pain is spread inside the thigh or leg, place him in a position that holds water according to what is done in the equalizing of the waters.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the manner of the water caused, and you have already written about it in the treatise on the rectification of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Prepare a solution of alkali and cause no extinzione of both parts, then tris them and place them in a new container from which the opening has been perforated, according to the quantity that goes into it.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And place the bottom of the other container with water into the solution of alkali and causes alive, then over that, two handfuls of the hot water from the vessel, and after you have compressed them well with your hand, leave the hot water to flow down from the vessel into the container with the cold water.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And then carefully adjust all that water, and pour it over another living cause and renew the alkali, because now it will become a strong remedy of great sharpness, which is administered in many medical operations and cauterization of other members, for operation uses fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And also among medicines are some that are cauterized widely, thus with greater intensity and more finely, causing a certain knowledge of their mixture.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	A wise old man recounts an operation and cure by which he alleviates the pain of water (perhaps hydrocephalus or a related condition) and sciatica, and marvels greatly at its effectiveness, stating that it requires no other treatment, for once recomposed in bath and rest, the patient is completely healed.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	Indeed, it is best to use fresh parsley from a garden, and if none is available, take a small figure; twist it in your hands and place it in the water where the pain resides, whether in the joint or limb or foot, and let it be.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it should be left for a duration of three hours or for as long as the patient's condition allows for relaxation from the strain.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	Then immerse him in water, and when the patient's body is heated, insert that into the sun, for the pain ceases and healing occurs.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And know that one should not use cautery with these medicines unless it is for the removal of fluids from the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	You may already know that when the narrow vein of a goat is cauterized, it benefits the animal; and the cautery should be done in this manner: take wool and dip it in ancient oil, and place it between the foot's toes and between the bones.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	Then take a dry goat's vein and inflame it over fire until it is charred, and place it on the wool and leave it until it hardens.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat this process, and do not cease to do so until the sensation of the bite reaches the water and relieves the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this type of cautery is called a cow cautery.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter LII.
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	On the cauterization of joint pain.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	At times, pain in the back is caused by various factors, such as stiffness or bruising, or due to excessive strain or improper evacuation, and for similar reasons, through the infusion of irritating and moist matter.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And cauterization is not indicated for any other type but this specific one caused by the infusion of irritating matter.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	Therefore, for the evacuation of the malady, use pills that resemble them, which are to be administered on each side where the pain is located in three lines according to its extent, making incisions on each line with cautery as much or little as tolerated by the patient and depending on their virtue.
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	And cauterization should be made with a pointed cautery.

Capitol .xliii.	Chapter .xliii.
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On cauterization at the onset of jaundice.
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	These maladies often appear in young children; and the sign of their onset in children is that their small bodies become stiff due to evening heat, raising and limiting their movements.
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And it examines the last vertebra of the spine and the joints that begin to protrude above the others.

que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	that takes the cautery across the entire span of the vertebra firmly.

Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the cauterization of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And thus, when gout is caused by cold and humid conditions, it is treated with heat and not forgotten the pain, then the application of a hot cautery follows.

E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And take a pointed cautery whose form is as follows:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar. E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	And if the pain persists in both feet, then administer the cautery as we have said in our chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pain is only in the joints and it is called rheum, then make punctures along the course of the filaments as they twist, punctures on those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if there are persistent pains in these joints, make punctures along the course of the filaments on each node and on the pinch of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	And if the pains spread to other joints or muscles, apply cautery to parts all over the body.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And do not discharge the patient without proper care and receipt of medicines, for if good care is taken and the fever is discharged through this cautery, God will help.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter .xlv. (This appears to be a section or chapter heading, not a translation.)
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On cauterization of breaks.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When there is a rupture in the joints and hernia protrudes from the abdominal wall towards the birth canal, at this point, it is necessary to begin by ensuring that the patient abstains from strenuous activity for a period of time, allowing the tear to heal from within the body.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	Then guide the patient to lie on their side with their leg raised, and instruct them to keep it in that position until the swelling or hernia goes down.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	Then return the patient to their original position, and carefully attempt to reduce the rupture over the hip bone, identifying the end of it by its resemblance to a half-circle at the upper joint lines of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Then apply the cautery in the shape that is appropriate for this case:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	Within which a moist and warm cloth should be applied.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	Then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And then apply the cautery over that sign with your hand holding the cautery straight, and focus on the area where you manage to get near the bone of the toe within the middle of the foot; and repeat that another time if it doesn't work in the first attempt near the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe carefully the movement of the hernia during the cauterization, so as not to dislocate the hernia and cause death or other serious complications on the patient.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And you should know that when you use a cautery, do not touch the bone, do not perform your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And take care that the cautery of children should be delicate according to their size and measure.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And take care of the site of the cautery for three days, applying bandages until the fire scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And take care of those with other burns until they are healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient should lie on their back for 40 days until the site is sealed and the pain disappears.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And take care to fast the patient according to the duration of their healing, which strengthens their stomach, and prevent the intestine from protruding due to effort in recovery.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when it is time to raise it, after approximately ten days, administer a suitable treatment and maintain it for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And it should also be reduced in work and the intake of food and drinking, and from loud voices, for when one follows this regimen of healing entirely, they will be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And now I will describe the treatment for hernias in other parts of the abdomen, which begins with a cauterization of the hernia using a red-hot iron, according to its size, and this should be done when it protrudes from the abdominal wall; then care should be taken with the treatment as described earlier, and it should not be compressed.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	Some have also said that the hernia should be cauterized with a triangular iron in this manner, because it is easily detected and tried.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And it is a pause line that they have for the width in the skin above the rupture, and another line above it; then place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cautery is more light and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLVI.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On cauterization of twists.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain ends in other members due to cold or impact persists and does not improve with medication, then you should cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the type of cautery for each member should be according to its size and depth, and the nature and location of the twist and pain it suffers.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore, if it is cured by the first cautery, good; otherwise, repeat the cautery on it; for usually those pains are punctures in members near to that member, so you should achieve these with cauteries until the illness is cured.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter .xlvii.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	About the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Leper patients sometimes require cauterization due to severe damage, especially if the type of leprosy is characterized by putrefaction of the flesh and melancholia.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so if you wish to cauterize the patient, consider whether the leprosy is severe and whether it has responded to the treatment mentioned in the previous section, nor has it recurred, or spread, and be wary of the disease that could engulf the entire body and all its parts. Then cauterize the affected area on top of the head with a hot iron: first at the middle of the scalp, then at the second spot beneath it towards the back of the head, reaching the forehead at the end of the hair; and do so in two places forming horns, and also behind, upon the nape or neck.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally, with your hand hold the cautery a little within, pressing it against the bone creating a slight impression, and dislocating the tendons so that the expulsion of thick vapors is alleviated; cauterize over the compress as necessary.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if leprosy has already spread over the body and appears manifestly, then you should cauterize with these cauteries that we have mentioned at the beginning; cauterize on the tip of the nose, and two cauteries on each eye lid, and two cauteries on both shoulders, and six cauteries on the spine, and five cauteries on the back vertebrae, and one large cautery near the coccyx, and one on the hip bone, and two on each thigh, and one on each knee, and two on each arm, and two on the muscles, and two on each foot's tendons; cauterize over all the joints of the upper and lower limbs, and on every heel of their feet, and on the grooves of their hands.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful of the nerves that are on the foot, do not irritate them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And in some cases, cautery is performed with a hot iron on the bone of the thigh, and on another part of the stomach's opening, and yet another on the sigmoid colon.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And you should know that the more accurately you perform the cautery, the greater its effectiveness and the less painful it is for the patient; indeed, since the nerves are already numbed due to the previous procedures, the body is already stunned.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And take note that the size of the cautery should be great or small according to the members and joints, as previously mentioned concerning the types of instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then, prepare the cautery with fine flour mixed with honey and other remedies as necessary until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter .xlviii.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On cauterization of stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a member is stuck or numbed and treated with medicines, oils, and dressings, but remains unsanated, you should cauterize the affected member with a cautery as required by the size or smallness of that member.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And the hot cautery should enter the depth of the flesh slightly.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that area with an ointment until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes a stupor is cauterized that extends to the upper and lower limbs, the spine, and the eyes, which cause pain in those members, and it alleviates the stupor.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	Do not attempt to treat this unless one is skilled in the anatomy of the body's members and the emergence of nerves throughout the whole body in motion.
Capitol .xlix.	**Chapter LXXIX**
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	**On the Cauterization of Hemorrhoids**
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When hemorrhoids are old and do not respond to any of the common medical treatments, then you cauterize them with a pointed iron according to the amount of the specific kind of cloth needed until the white and color of it are reduced and its color changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then prepare a mixture of flour from beans and lentils with olive oil and arugula leaves, or pigeon's blood or duck blood, each in equal parts, and apply it to the affected area until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Capital .1.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the cauterization of cracks.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins to form and it is desired to remove that growth, cauterize it with a circular cautery along its edge as it is turned.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the wise ones say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle location; however, I have not seen this, as I fear it may become ulcerated, and I have already seen this a few times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	It is more prudent to cauterize it along the edge of the growth with a circular cautery as we have said, or with multiple cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Final chapter.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On the cauterization of injuries.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When an injury takes too long to heal, it may be due to excessive moisture, the condition of the patient, being old and frail with little strength, or time; if you wish to hasten the healing of the injury, cauterize around it with small pointed cauteries; then apply a compress to aid in its maturation.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	If you wish to make an incision with a cautery, then heat the cautery whose form is thus: and apply it to the middle of the injury until the needle penetrates.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is applied to that place which is most affected, in order that the body of the arm may be relieved; and then take care of it until it is healed.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter II.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On the cauterization of corrosion.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosion is a creeping corruption in the member which eats away just as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you encounter that corrosion in a place which requires cauterization with fire, then you should use hot iron needles, small and large as appropriate for that place where the corrosion is located.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize it completely until you have eradicated all the corrosion and do not leave any cause for it to return.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then bandage it for three days, and apply oil mixed with the ashes to the cauterized places until all the scars are completely eradicated and all corruption is gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then care for it using hot compresses made from fresh meat.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	If the flesh does not heal well in three days, free from corruption, then it is good; otherwise, repeat the cautery over what is broken in the corrupted places.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And it is treated with some sharp medicine several times, for that is half the effect of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	However, cautery with fire is sometimes more effective for removing impurities.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And you have already mentioned the cure for it with sharp medicine in the division, so take that when you see it coming on again.
Capitol .liii.	**Chapter III**
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On Cauterization of Joints and Similar Conditions
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Motas visible in the parts of the foot affected by malady, which is called a claw, and it is a gross, penetrating condition that weakens the foot; cautery on these is done in two ways, either with hot cautery or with cold cautery.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	Cautery with fire involves igniting the cautery tool, which is made of iron according to the size of the claw, and it should have subtle edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	Then apply the ignited cautery to the claw and carefully rotate your hand with the cautery around the claw until it reaches the depth of the claw.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave it for three days until it starts to heal.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	Then apply a plaster made from crushed wild mallows mixed with salt to the affected area and leave it for one night so that it eradicates the root cause.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with a wound healing ointment made from animal fat until it heals.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	If it does not improve and ulcers appear on the surface of the body, especially in the hands and feet, then you must apply these cauterizes with hot water. Take a small piece of iron or a pen or a turning wheel, and place it over the joint; then dip the tip of the instrument into hot water, and with your hand compress it firmly against the affected area, constantly turning the edge of the instrument around the joint's root, until you see the water flow out. Wait for about an hour while the patient endures the biting sensation of the hot water, and then remove it; the joint will be rid of its inflammation.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And also, for those who have these issues, it is done to ensure that all of them are completely healed.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then treat the abscesses that have been eliminated from the joint roots with ointments made from materials that promote healing of the flesh.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter III.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the cauterization of tremors.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When you encounter a tremor caused by friction or pressure on the nerves, or due to fever or any other similar cause, you should apply four cauterizations or two cautery irons over each spinal column; also cauterize the foot of the patient and the stomach with olive cautery irons.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor of the patient will cease and hasten the healing of the afflicted illness.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter V.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the cauterization of sudden accidents to the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body white spots appear, and pustules are formed from coarse corrupt matter; therefore at the beginning when you see an appearance, cauterize it over all parts of the fistula with a subtle cautery or a reed torch, the tip of which is extended towards fire; or cut off with a long knife; or cauterize with a lenticular.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And in some cases, cauterization is also performed at the beginning of its expulsion according to this manner; they are not rigid, and the surplus matter is removed, doing those, and healing from those.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	However, it may be necessary to cover that this should be done with evacuation through phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On cauterization of flux of gangrene through incision of the arc (or tendon).
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Various observed phenomena must flow from archery, which cut through the wound to be healed, or from the beginning of abscesses or cauterization on a member, and then they appear similar, and it is difficult to maintain that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, whenever this happens to anyone, you must use your hand over the wound from the impact of the archery, and place it as indicated to stop the flow of blood until the swelling has subsided.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then apply hot olive oil cautery, both small and large in number, over these until they are covered with fire.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take from those a small or large one according to the location and wound in which the artery is broken, over that vein quickly pour the heated oil you have prepared, and cauterize it until it is incised and restricted that flow.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the orifices of the artery as you remove the cautery and extract it, take another cautery carefully from among those prepared over the fire, and do not cease to do this again until the bleeding is stopped.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful not to injure the nerves here, which may lead to further harm to the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And you should know that when blood flows from the artery, it is not possible to constrict the bleeding, especially when the artery is large, unless by one of four methods: either with a cautery as we have said, or by extraction when it is not extracted, for when its extremities are cut off, the bleeding is restricted and the sanction is confined; or by binding it tightly with twine or ligament due to strong compression, or by applying medications of which the virtue is to constrict the blood; and these should be strengthened with a pillow or in a suitable manner.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	He who administers a moderate restriction of it with bandages or by the position of burning causes and similar ones, does not bring relief but merely pain.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If this must be done for someone and neither the doctor nor medicine is present, then open the indicated site on the affected vein as we have said, and understand the great constriction of it within, so that the blood may be stopped from the sovereign outbreak of the plague, and above all, do not let the pain return; and afterward, sprinkle hot water with great frigidity within until the blood is congealed and thickened; and then consider what cautery or medicine is necessary.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second step.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Regarding incision and perforation, poultices and phlebotomy, wounds, and their likes.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucazis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	In the first chapter, we have discussed all diseases in which fire cauterization is indicated, along with their causes and occasions, and the instruments necessary for the forms of cauterization. I have organized the chapters from head to foot.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And you will proceed in this chapter in such a way that it alleviates what the patient desires, whenever he has asked for it.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before you begin, remember that this chapter is about the treatment of fear, which is discussed in detail in the first chapter on cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because you must be extremely careful in the operation discussed in this chapter, which involves frequent catheters evacuation due to the presence of sand or foreign objects in which life is at risk, you must perform irrigation of the vein or incision over the abscess or inspection for discharge or purification of the wound or extraction of an arrow or incision of the pelvis and similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And among all of those, there are fear and trembling, and in most of their hearts, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that this should not fall upon you, for sometimes you must be on your guard against the ways of men, as well as against the violent ways of illnesses.
