E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do the same with the flail botomy of him as you have done with the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the treatment of the superficial vein of phlebotomy is for maladies that are left in the extremities of the body, as well as for illnesses of the heart, and to retain menstruation, and for maladies of old varicose veins and ulcers in the thighs and legs, and similar ailments.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of phlebotomy on him is that the illness immerses its foot in water, causing friction until the veins appear; and it is applied over the joint of the foot with a belt; and the position of the vein is then marked after the pus has been drained, and from there it branches out towards the surface of the foot in many directions.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And therefore, drain the pus widely from the vein, leaving the hernia below the foot, after its elevation, for it is better and more salutary.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you perform phlebotomy on the surface of the foot, then be careful of the nerves that are left underneath the skin of the foot, and place your phlebotomy tool at an angle, as if you wanted to incise it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And make the bloodletting successful.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	If it is forbidden to raise the leg, then you should immerse the foot in warm water and let the blood flow out until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist makes a mistake on the first attempt, then he should repeat the phlebotomy in another place, since the spot is clean; and do not fear any harm from it, but be careful of the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And do the same for the other foot equally.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the spot as we have said is below the knee at the entrance of the wild branch.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the purpose of the phlebotomy on him is to relieve hip pain when it is caused by blood stagnation.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the technique of phlebotomy in this case is that the disease enters the veins, and quickly and tightly draws out the blood from the thigh on both sides, using a long, thin bandage, so that it only appears through this means.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore, when it appears, you perform phlebotomy on that part according to each method that is within your ability and according to the direction, and it is better; either incise it with an incision or sec it with a section, because the location of the disease is hot.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in many people very painful; and if you find it, and it does not appear in the sensation of all, perform phlebotomy on one branch of the disease, and that is the one that appears on the back of the foot instead of the little toe and the ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And pay attention to the nerves, and let the blood flow from the wound as much as you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then carefully dislodge the tightness and press upon the site of the flebotomy, tightly securing the place, as it is said to be salutary.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventilation and the qualities of use of those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventilators are of three types: of horns, or of glass, or of metal.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventilation is achieved according to two manners: one of them is through lancing and draining of pus, and the other is through ventilation without lancing.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation through lancing is according to two manners, either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the ventilators that are administered through lancing and draining of pus are twelve places in the body, of which one is where ventilation is paused, and it is the last opening in the head; and two openings from each side of the nape; and ventilators under the jaw, leaving the mandible below the mouth; and ventilators of two blades; and ventilators of two holes, and they are each two cubits long; and ventilators of two pegs; and ventilators of two cushions.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And the extraction of the sanies should not be from small veins scattered in the flesh, and thus does not catch the virtue through them, as is the case with phlebotomy; nor should it be covered that ventozacio (venisectomy) be done with fire or heat in any disease caused by congestion within until the body is entirely evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	If it is necessary to cause venisectomy for illness or continuously, we should do so at the beginning and end of the month, in its middle part, and at any time suitable for it.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of which men are those in whom the sanies (or blood) is multiplied until they require extraction through venisectomy and find great difficulty and pain; and from these, congestion and redness appear on their face and head, and in their eyes; and from these, puffiness appears on their face and forehead and darkness and weakness in their legs; and from those whose place of venisectomy leaks; and from these, their laughter increases; and from these, they taste blood in their mouths or their tongues are inflamed and spitting out blood; and from these, their sleep increases, and from those who sweat blood while sleeping, ancient and painful plagues and other similar causes appear.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when it occurs for any reason among those, and especially if it is in the third or middle of the month, they command ventilation to be done rather than waiting two or three hours past the day.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	The immediate relief from ventilation of the neck is that when it alleviates pressure on the head and what sinks into the holes; it is more effective than anything else in evacuating all the body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventilation is at the site of phlebotomy of the head.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not advisable to use that which is of cold and wet nature, or where catarrh is present, as it causes great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for this reason, one should not use those herbs, especially in the cases of hardened pain in the joints and on the tops of which hardships are present.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	May it be done to him who is lying on his side that he experiences relief; and for this reason you must command the bellows operator to place his hand gently over the suction points, lest there be a loss of the generated relief.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	The use of the bellows over the chest (pulmonic) area is instead of phlebotomy of the superficial vein and basilic: and thus it confers relief to asthma, and to the constriction of the airways and the cutting of the muscle of the chest, and to coughing, and to congestion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is necessary that the bellows over the chest be gently moved, for if it is suddenly stopped, it generates weakness in the body and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the bellows over the head confers relief to accidental pains in the head and ophthalmia, and migraines, and pressure, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is instead of phlebotomy of the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And be sure to instruct the fan (or attendant) not to press their hand during the scraping so as not to puncture the artery and cause bleeding.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And the ventilation of the mouth is done by applying alcohol to it, and for the corruption (or inflammation) of the gums, and for conditions resembling those in the mouth, which are in place of phlebotomy with leech saliva, that is applied between the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the ventilation that is done on both plates gives a heat cap, which is made by replacing with warmth.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the ventilation of both parts inside the cavities gives an effect similar to phlebotomy of three veins, namely the basilic, femoral and cephalic veins; these attract the blood from all those manually accessible veins and also from the smaller veins connected to the larger ones, so as to achieve an attraction to the three mentioned veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And instruct the bellows-man not to overdo the scarification, for the place is denuded of flesh, leaving only nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a bellows used to blow over the anus and apply to hemorrhoids in the rear end and to pus ulcers left behind.
